retest vs please
retest vs please
retest vs please
retest vs image

> Why not choose to put it as a field in `VLAN_INTERFACE`?
> 
> ```
>     "VLAN_INTERFACE": {
>         "Vlan1000": {
>             "mac": "00:00:11:22:33:44",
>         },
> ```

VLAN_INTERFACE is handled by intfmgr and not vlanmgr. We would want this to be handled by Vlanmgr. Also similar to mtu, mac also is a layer 2 property while creating interface in kernel by Vlanmgr. That was the rationale.
retest vs please
@qiluo-msft , the function does not seem like a mock. why do we need it?
It is a mock. Without it, a Redis service is required to run gtest unit tests.

> lgtm, did you see any functional issue by having random mac address for bridge?

In kernel STP module, the bridge_id consists of priority and bridge mac address. The random mac address may led to different protocol role selection in the same network.

latestReviews.body: lgtm, did you see any functional issue by having random mac address for bridge?

>For unsupported DROP counters the string returned is the enum value as a string, whose max length is 2. Calling a substring with a length greater than 2 was crashing syncd.

@smaheshm is this something new in 4.2?

> > For unsupported DROP counters the string returned is the enum value as a string, whose max length is 2. Calling a substring with a length greater than 2 was crashing syncd.
> 
> @smaheshm is this something new in 4.2?

SDK seems to be a bit ahead w.r.t. SAI. We also need to update SAI and SAIREDIS. In any case we should have this check to avoid crash.

> > > For unsupported DROP counters the string returned is the enum value as a string, whose max length is 2. Calling a substring with a length greater than 2 was crashing syncd.
> > 
> > 
> > @smaheshm is this something new in 4.2?
> 
> SDK seems to be a bit ahead w.r.t. SAI. We also need to update SAI and SAIREDIS. In any case we should have this check to avoid crash.

Agreed! Thanks for catching this! :smile:

@nazariig , can you please provide a link to 201911 PR?

> 
> 
> @nazariig , can you please provide a link to 201911 PR?

Please check this PR: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/1441

> 
> 
> I would prefer to use positive boollean parameters, e.g. enableForwarding. That way the calculation (state == 'enabled') looks more natural then (state == 'disabled').
> This is a minor suggestion up to your discretion.

The idea behind checking `disabled` is to leverage SAI default attribute values.
This is a kind of optimization, just to avoid passing redundant attributes, since forwarding is enabled by default.
If you still think that making it thru `enabled` is a preferred way, please let me know and i will update the logic.
@yxieca please let me know if you have any objection on merging this one.
@yxieca i have made changes per your request. Please review & merge.

> @yxieca i have made changes per your request. Please review & merge.

reviews.body:
I would prefer to use positive boollean parameters, e.g. enableForwarding. That way the calculation (state == 'enabled') looks more natural then (state == 'disabled').
This is a minor suggestion up to your discretion.

@stephenxs can you fix this:

```
orch.cpp: In member function 'ref_resolve_status Orch::resolveFieldRefArray(type_map&, const string&, swss::KeyOpFieldsValuesTuple&, std::vector<long unsigned int>&, std::string&)':
orch.cpp:609:41: error: 'strlen' argument missing terminating nul [-Werror=stringop-overflow=]
  609 |                     object_name_list += string(&list_item_delimiter);
      |                                         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
In file included from orch.cpp:6:
orch.h:25:12: note: referenced argument declared here
   25 | const char list_item_delimiter = ',';
      |            ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
cc1plus: all warnings being treated as errors
```

i get this error on master with all enabled errors, im not sure why this don't pop up on jenkins build, my gcc: gcc version 9.1.0 (GCC)

Hi @kcudnik ,
Looks like I'm not able to install gcc-9 on buster docker. Could you please provide steps in which you installed it?
I also searched this error and got this: [GCC 9: special_values_formatter.hpp:43:16: error: 'strlen' argument missing terminating nul #29](https://github.com/CauldronDevelopmentLLC/cbang/issues/29). According to this page, it's a bug of boost while compiling by gcc9 and can be suppressed by using `-Wno-stringop-overflow` which disables this warning.
Can you also check whether this works for you?
Thanks
ok, can you add then this option co configure?
